questions.title: Question 1 for Class 190913
questions.main: The most frequent time of day for tornadoes to form is in the:

mcq.option: A) early morning just after sunrise
B) late morning just before noon
C) evening just after sunset
D) afternoon
E) middle of the night

questions.title: Question 2 for Class 190913
questions.main: How does a tornado watch differ from a tornado warning?
questions.answer: When tornadoes are likely to form during the next few hours a tornado watch is issued to alert the public that tornadoes may develop within a specific area during a certain time period. Once a tornado is spotted  -  either visually or on a radar screen  -  a tornado warning is issued.

questions.title: Question 3 for Class 190913
questions.main: Which of the following statements about tornadoes is correct?
questions.answer: D) the United States has more tornadoes that any other country in the world

mcq.option: A) all tornadoes rotate in a counterclockwise direction
B) tornadoes never strike the same place twice
C) all tornadoes make a distinction roar
D) the United States has more tornadoes that any other country in the world

questions.title: Question 4 for Class 190913
questions.main: In a typical tornado the winds are usually not much more than ____ miles per hour.

questions.title: Question 5 for Class 190913
questions.answer: C) a tornado warning is issued

mcq.option: A) a tornado watch is issued
B) its direction of movement is carefully monitored by aircraft
C) a tornado warning is issued
D) hail begins to fall from the cloud
E) attempts may be made to change its direction of movement

questions.title: Question 6 for Class 190913
questions.main: Where are the days and nights of equal length all year long?

mcq.option: B) nowhere
D) at the Equator

questions.title: Question 7 for Class 190913
questions.main: Give two reasons for the possible increase in the average number of tornadoes reported in the United States during the past six decades.
questions.answer: This increase may be due to the fact that more people now live in areas where tornadoes are prevalent; hence many tornadoes that would have gone undetected in years past are now reported. Another reason for the tornado increase may be due to the improvements in radar technology that makes identifying a tornado easier today than in the past.

questions.title: Question 8 for Class 190913
questions.main: Explain why 'tornado families' are often so deadly.
questions.answer: The deadliest tornadoes are those that occur in families; that is different tornadoes spawned by the same thunderstorm. (Some thunderstorms produce a sequence of several tornadoes over two or more hours and over distances of 50 miles or more.) Tornado families oft en are the result of a single long-lived supercell thunderstorm. When a large number of tornadoes (typically six or more) form over a particular region this constitutes what is termed a tornado outbreak.

questions.title: Question 9 for Class 190913
questions.main: In July at middle latitudes in the Northern Hemisphere the day is ____ long and is  ____ with each passing day.
questions.answer: D) more than 12 hours, getting shorter

mcq.option: A) less than 12 hours, getting longer
B) less than 12 hours, getting shorter
C) more than 12 hours, getting longer
D) more than 12 hours, getting shorter

questions.title: Question 10 for Class 190913
questions.main: In clear weather the air next to the ground is usually ____ than the air above during the night and ____ than the air above during the day.

mcq.option: A) colder, warmer
B) colder, colder
C) warmer, colder
D) warmer, warmer
